comments.body:
Having this in perl is a bit worrying, given that most of the TensorFlow maintainers are not perl users :)

So this script will have to be rewritten at some point in Python, but I guess in the mean time having the generated files checked in works out well.
Python would probably look a bit cleaner. I'm not Pythonic enough to do the conversion easily, though.

@kbsriram also suggested this might be done in Java. If there is going to be a master program that generates a lot of Java source code, rather than just a simple largely straight-line script like the one that exists now, then writing it in a statically typed language makes a lot of sense to me. I am not yet clear on how this would interact with the Java code that he is working on for ops.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@#!/usr/bin/perl
#
# Copyright 2017 The TensorFlow Authors. All Rights Reserved.
